III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Consultant provided technical support in making sure the Fire Safety
Compliance Record is completed on a Juvenile Court Operated Facilities
(BCAL-82) form and not the Child Caring Institution (CWL-2424) form.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultant provided a copy of the variance for Rule 400.10115 Tuberculosis
screening for employees and volunteers.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
Not applicable
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and staff noted they feel
very supportive within their jobs. They reported they can always go to their direct
supervisor for support and administration always has a welcoming door open to

talk. Staff reported the main thing they are working on is making sure staff have
consistency for the youth. They reported this has been a big training aspect to the
facility, especially with new staff.
Three youth were interviewed during the inspection. They all reported they feel
safety at the facility and have a positive relationship with the staff. The youth all
reported enjoying the food at the facility. They reported grievances are taken
seriously and they have always received follow up from leadership staff at the
facility. The main complaint the youth had about the facility was that they have
younger youth on the pod which can be frustrating with their behaviors.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on June 26, 2024.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
